questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Italy is known for its extensive collection of ancient Roman houses, streets, and public baths, buried by a catastrophic eruption in 79 AD?
questions.context: The eruption of Mount Vesuvius that buried this site is one of the most famous in European history.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in Malaysia is one of the tallest twin tower structures in the world, completed in 1998?
questions.context: These towers were the tallest buildings in the world until 2004, featuring a skybridge between them.

questions.question: Where did the historic Battle of Hastings occur in 1066, leading to Norman conquest of England?
questions.context: The battle marked the start of a new era in English history with Duke William of Normandy's victory.

questions.question: Which famous museum in France houses the iconic painting known as 'Mona Lisa'?
questions.context: This museum is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in the heart of Paris.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Jordan is famed for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, once the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom?
questions.context: Known as the 'Rose City' due to the color of the stone, it is one of the New7Wonders of the World.
